title: S+ for a Carry is largely biased
body:
Because... because the thing that it takes into account the most is cs. And do you know how to play like an asshole? Taking all the farm on the map even though you've already farmed your six items. I've just played like that, a lotta deaths, zero pink wards, but hey I farmed my 500+ cs, I "deserve" an S+ now (Look at those poor small raptors and golems dying and giving me +10g each but hey it's still 1 cs, right?). Nevermind that my team couldn't finish their sixth items because of me. "OMG, I've got an S+, WHOOHOO"
This is a fucking joke.
Seriously Rito, revise how grades are calculated for carry please.

Edit: I've had 10k gold surplus that game, the gold that could've went in my allies pocket, but hey, that wouldn't give me an S+, right?

Based on my and others long-time experience

There's an insane amount of variables that would have to be taken into account, and you have no control group. Saying based on my and others long-time experiences is equal to no proof at all. Unless you and all these other people played the same champ in the same role with the same amount of wards, kills, assists, objectives taken ect ontop of CS. It takes into account map presence, kills, assists, deaths, CS, wards, objective control, game duration, and more that I'm probably missing or unaware of, and compares it to other people playing the same role with the same champ. You could have a giant group of people try to test it, but it won't matter, because everything is constantly changing with millions of players always playing. Everything influences the grade you get

Um, that is hugely false. Supports rarely take cs yet they can be the only person the team to get an S+, S, or S-. Also, Riot said that it takes into account your role and the attributes of that role. 

The main thing is NOT to loose your tower because as the "guardian" of that lane is too ensure that it stays strong (jg is an exception of course). 
Supports need to ensure their team gets kills and is able to leave safely (sometimes at the cost of their own life).
ADC's need to be able to push lane and decimate the enemy team while not feeding. 
Top (same as ADC, also needs to start team fights if tanky) 
Mid (same as other lanes, can start team-fights)

But, you also have to help with objectives. 

Top / Bot help jg with leash. 
Dragons / Barons / Rift heralds 
Towers / Inhibitors
They take into account farm, items built, kills, deaths, and assists. 

But, they mainly base stuff off of if you played your role correctly and efficiently. Sometimes it takes getting that right team. For me, I have a partner (Leona supp) that decimates bot lane with me (MF adc). Our partnership has already earned us 3 S's in a row (I'm S5 and he / she is unranked doing placements today). 

Mainly, the more that ***you*** are helping with, the more that you will be higher graded. As for your problem, the ADC's farming ties in with their role. They need to farm, push lanes, build items and so forth. Several factors played into that, not just the farming. Someone can have poor farming but still get an S grade. I have read multiple articles and the authors agree that the top three things are: 

1. K/D/A (Kills are weighted less than deaths) 
2. Lane Push (Part of your role) 
3. Teamwork (Umm, this is a team game so...) 

But, if you have read this far thank you. I know that this is just an opinion, and no one needs to take this as the truth, but don't just believe that farming is the top thing in LoL.
>for a carry
The dumbest thing is rank based on cs in ARAM. You can have great score, carry your team, 1v5 and.... still no S, because you let your Nasus farm some Qs.

>because the thing that it takes into account the most is cs.

If this were true, it would preclude that supports couldn't possibly get S ratings. I actually find the opposite to be true: I believe that I have a higher percent of S rated games as support than I do on other roles (and my main is jungle, so it's not like I play a shitload of sup and am hugely experienced on it).

It is true. Rankings are based off of other player's performances with them. So if the average cs of support Sona's is 5 cs a game then if you get more than 5 cs you are increasing your ranking.

By how much I have no clue. But yes you can CS the hell out of a game as a support and get a higher ranking for it.

I don't know if these are all the factors but the main factors are:

1. Kills
2. Deaths
3. Assists
4. CS

And yes the CS one does include supports.

But do you know which category has the highest impact and you didn't even list? Winning the game. It is virtually impossible to get S- or better after a loss (I've only done it a handful of times in hundreds of games). If you play for these stats, your chance of getting S rank goes down. Play the game to win, and you might get an S. Play to get the S, and you almost certainly will not succeed.

I... get S's after like every game on my mains--including losses :o

The only reason your rank goes down is because you most likely had more deaths than normal in a losing game as opposed to a winning game.

However if you end the game with 1 or 2 deaths and otherwise a normal score you can still easily obtain an S. Just pick your fights wisely and don't die for nuffin.

So actually the opposite of what you said is true. Play to get an S and you will most likely get an S since your score will be optimized for it. Play to win and you have less of a chance since playing to win involves possible self-sacrifice for the victory.

>I... get S's after like every game on my mains--including losses :o

Then you play uncommon champs. If you played hecarim this summer, you would know just how fkin impossible it was to get S or better meta champs. I had a string of wins where I went 10/1 or so on average with varying numbers of assists and sometimes didn't even get the S-. Hell, a few times I've gone 10/0 for A-, which is retarded. It depends on how many people are playing the champ. Meta champs get spammed, so it's harder to get high ratings on them. However, winning the game is a HUGE factor, also because winning the game generally creates a situation where you have a higher KDA and better CS.

The reason it's harder on champions who generally outperform others is because they overperform. So performing an average "good" score means nothing if the average score for that champion is something ridiculous.

Also! Alot of the time it means you have to be good at CS'ing. So many ADC's perform really well objectively but don't get a high CS score and therefore do not rate the S.

CS matters. And also it ain't about winning. Winning just usually means you and your allies did better than worse. But if you won via making proper decisions such as possibly tanking something to the death to allow another ally to go on a rampage as long as possible in teamfights then you have less of a chance for an S even if you got assists from those deaths and won the game. If you didn't even get many assists or any from those deaths then you most likely won't even get an S. And by being dead you don't participate in getting the objective afterward which typically means an even lower score.

However, if you were to make it your main objective to score S you can not prioritize on victory and instead prioritize on not dying, CS, objectives, kills and assists in that order.

For example: You just aced the enemy except for a Caitlyn and your team is doing baron but it's only you, your tank jungler and your ADC who is low enough for a free ult kill but so are you. Cait ults, targeting your ADC but your team needs him alive in order to DPS baron since your jg is a tank and the jg is too far away from the ADC.

Do you take the bullet for the increased chance of victory? Or let him eat it so you don't have to take a death and a non-participation in a huge objective (baron) which would result in a possible non-S rank?

See? There are definitely cases where you can choose S over victory. Idk why you ever would but most of the time it ends up being choosing victory over S.

But it also compares your CS to other players' CS on that same champion. So it is pretty fair unless you play something like Twitch jungle where he won't get much CS.
But then it compares you to people who play Twitch in the jungle, so it balances out.

Good observation. However, Twitch jungle has only been picked 12% of the time on this patch while ADC Twitch has nearly been picked 80% of the time.  So you would mostly be competing with the 80% in CS.

That isn't how it works though. It only takes into account those playing him jungle. If I were to take, say Darius support, and do even decently, it would give me a high grade because /nobody/ plays Darius support. That's why people who play AD Thresh top and do  well get S's, it only compares you to the sample of other people who have played in that particular role with that particular champion.

If you need any proof that cs matters more than anything when it comes to getting an S, here's my proof when going as {{champion:78}} Support ....

**Score:** 7 / 1 / 16
**Time:** 33 min, 11 sec
**Dragons:** 2
**Towers:** 11
**CS: ** 61
**Grade:** S-

***

**Score:** 5 / 1 / 17
**Time:** 29 min, 52 sec
**Dragons:** 3
**Towers: ** 11
**CS:** 65
**Grade:** S+

**Proof Links:** http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2360452509/219480029?tab=overview

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2360456658/219480029?tab=overview

Comparing them, apart from beating the game 4 minutes earlier than the previous, with an extra dragon assist ... the CS influenced my grade the hardest. Why? Despite getting 2 kills more in my previous, it didn't even grant me a solid S. I also doubt getting the extra assist in my 5 / 1 / 17 game did it either but my CS was 4 more (simply because I stole krugs from enemy jungle that game) and my grade went over a solid and into a S+ .... 

**Conclusion:** The grading system cares more about your cs than anything else. It doesn't matter if your 1 death helped your team steal Baron or your lack of CS was to help your other laners catch up ... hell, you can go 16 / 1 / 11 as {{champion:113}} Jungle like I did but get an A+ despite you were helping your team with ganks / scoring objectives / getting kills like a boss. Meanwhile my top laner {{champion:92}} went 9 / 6 / 14 and got an S+ because her cs was above 250 .... even he thought it was odd.

Be selfish, only focus on yourself, don't risk dying in team fights for whatever reason, and farm your @$$ off even if you're a support and you'll get that well deserved but flawed S+ .... :^)
